185956246.review:
Spore — это настоящая жемчужина в мире видеоигр, которая предлагает уникальный и захватывающий опыт. С самого начала игроки погружаются в увлекательный процесс создания собственного существа, что дает возможность проявить свою креативность. Дизайн персонажей и их эволюция — это просто невероятно!

Одной из самых сильных сторон Spore является разнообразие игровых этапов. От простейших организмов до сложных цивилизаций, каждый этап наполнен интересными механиками и задачами. Игроки могут исследовать обширные галактики, взаимодействовать с другими цивилизациями и даже создавать свои собственные планеты. Это ощущение безграничного творчества и свободы действительно завораживает.

Графика в игре яркая и красочная, а звуковое оформление создает атмосферу, которая дополняет игровой процесс. Кроме того, возможность делиться своими созданиями с другими игроками добавляет игре социальный аспект, который делает ее еще более увлекательной.

В целом, Spore — это игра, которая вдохновляет на творчество и исследование. Она подходит как для casual-геймеров, так и для тех, кто ищет более глубокий и многогранный игровой опыт. Если вы хотите попробовать что-то новое и необычное, Spore — отличный выбор! 5/5

Definitely, even in 2025.
The publisher has all but abandoned it, however!
The community has not! You can still to this day find a plethora of mods for this game.
And a dedicated following of players who still enjoy it and are actively involved.

It's like the No Man's Sky of it's day, it was meant to be Maxis Studio's magnum Opus, but they soared too close to the sun.

But don't let that deter you, it's still a great game, despite it's age and original mixed reception.
You can get away with a lot here, especially if your open to modding the game.
I am fairly new to the game however I've already managed to enhance it's graphic's on my own without mod support via tools and software.

I actually ended up preferring the none full resolution old school original graphic's of the game.
But that's just how I am, pretty graphic's always distract me. But if you wanted to improve them you totally can!

Also, you can't beat the price, it was only 2 dollars USD on sale xD
So you haven't got much too lose.
I highly recommend, certainly even if you only get a few hours out of it.

185665903.review:
Don't buy it on Steam. For many reasons:

1. The game is quite old, and its Steam version hasn't been updated for a long time, so the game and its DLCs are displayed as three separate games in the Steam library, which causes confusion: What should I launch? Should I download all three? If yes, does the order matter?

2. Spore's in-game servers are shut down. You can't create a Spore account, which means you won't be able to use any of the game's online features.

3. The game crashes. At least for me. I couldn't even start playing.

My experience with the game went like this: First, I didn't understand which of the three games I should launch. I found an article online suggesting that I download all three, then open them in order and log into a Spore account in each. I tried this, only to find that the servers supporting Spore accounts for Steam are shut down, so I couldn't do it. Another article suggested using an EA account instead of a Spore one to log in (which is an available option in the game), but for that, I needed to have Spore on my EA account as well. I decided to contact EA customer service. The whole process took about an hour and a half, but eventually, they told me they no longer support the Steam version of Spore and gave me Spore + DLCs for my EA account. Finally, I used my EA credentials to log into the game on Steam, and it finally worked. I could see other people's creatures and the "Galactic Adventures" button. Alas, all this effort was for nothing because whenever I tried to start playing or open the settings, the game just crashed.

At least they gave me a copy of Spore for the EA app. I hope it works better there.

185563120.review:
Каждые пять лет я возвращаюсь в Spore, и это уже стало для меня своеобразной традицией. Эта игра — не просто проект от Maxis, а целая вселенная, которая всегда готова принять тебя обратно. Она вызывает ностальгию по тем временам, когда открытие каждой новой стадии чувствовалось как свершение, а создание существ было настоящей магией.

Каждый этап — от клетки до космоса — несёт в себе свою уникальную атмосферу. Пусть механики местами кажутся упрощёнными, а визуализация уже не дотягивает до современных стандартов, но Spore цепляет своей душой. Ты строишь мир, населённый своими творениями, и каждый раз удивляешься тому, как из забавного комочка может вырасти нечто величественное.

Игра напоминает, что даже спустя годы ты можешь вернуться, чтобы ощутить ту же радость первооткрывателя. Это как навещать старого друга — не ради новизны, а ради воспоминаний и чувства дома. Spore — это традиция, которая не стареет.

Ah Spore, the quintessential evolution game. I find that this childhood classic stands the test of time. 

From cell stage to space stage this game is binge-able. The different game mechanics at each stage are tons of fun, and I love the level of customization and play style variety. The depth is great, and the visuals are so cute!

The graphics are what you would expect from a 2009 game, and I find that the Space stage can drag on - Stellaris mastered what Spore failed to here, the mechanics and interface are surprisingly similar! I also wish the game had just a little more to each stage (excluding the space stage). l

All this being said, this is one of my favourite games of all time, and I must recommend a playthrough. See your cell increase in size, then make your creature do a little dance. Enjoy playing a song in the Tribal stage, then designing a city in Civilization stage.

185464552.review:
Spore is a unique and ambitious game that taps into the joy of creation and exploration, offering a journey through the stages of life, from a humble single-celled organism to an intergalactic empire. Developed by Maxis and Will Wright, the game captures a sense of wonder and creativity that feels especially nostalgic for those who experienced it during childhood. For many players, including myself, the Space Stage stood out as the pinnacle of this imaginative adventure.

The game begins in the primordial soup, where you guide a simple organism through the Cell Stage, eating and growing until you’re ready to evolve. From there, you transition through the Creature, Tribal, and Civilization stages, each offering distinct gameplay mechanics. While these early stages are fun and lighthearted, they serve primarily as a prelude to the vast and open-ended Space Stage.

The Space Stage is where Spore truly comes into its own. As you venture into the cosmos, the game transforms into an expansive sandbox of exploration, diplomacy, and conquest. The sheer scale of the galaxy is awe-inspiring, with countless procedurally generated planets and star systems to discover. Each planet feels like a blank canvas, inviting you to terraform, colonize, or simply admire its unique features.

What makes the Space Stage so special is the freedom it offers. Whether you want to become a benevolent explorer, forging alliances and spreading life, or a ruthless conqueror, dominating and pillaging planets, the choice is entirely yours. The ability to design your own spaceships and interact with alien civilizations adds a personal touch to every encounter.

The creative tools in Spore are another highlight. The editors for creatures, buildings, vehicles, and spaceships are intuitive yet deep, allowing for endless possibilities. Seeing your creations come to life, from the microscopic to the cosmic, is incredibly rewarding and fuels your imagination.

The game’s visuals, while simple by today’s standards, have a charm that holds up well. The quirky animations and colorful environments give Spore a playful and inviting aesthetic. The sound design complements this beautifully, with whimsical effects and a dynamic soundtrack that evolves with each stage.

However, Spore isn’t without its flaws. The early stages, while enjoyable, can feel shallow and repetitive compared to the Space Stage. Some players may find the lack of depth in certain mechanics disappointing, especially given the game’s ambitious premise. Despite these shortcomings, the game’s charm and creativity shine through, making it a memorable experience.

For those of us who grew up with Spore, the Space Stage remains a standout memory, a vast playground where you could explore the galaxy, create your own narrative, and feel like the ruler of the stars. It’s a testament to the game’s enduring appeal that so many players fondly remember their time in its universe.

Spore may not be a perfect game, but it’s an unparalleled celebration of creativity and imagination. It’s a game that sparks curiosity, encourages experimentation, and leaves a lasting impression. For anyone seeking a nostalgic trip or a unique gaming experience, Spore remains a cherished gem that captures the wonder of exploration and the joy of creation.

185386530.review:
It's a timeless game with endless possibilities of how to approach it. Every decision determines your future and how your skills will help you explore the whole world - and later, dominate space. You can create your own species and the more you play, the more structures become available that must be designed as well. So not only do you have a choice of how you interact with other beings, but also how you design your houses, cars, ships, planes or spaceships. It's a nostalgic game that holds up even today, except for the potato graphics. I played countless hours with the CD version back then, so I don't mind, but a little redesign and more pixels wouldn't hurt.

Still, it's a game I'll play forever and never stop talking about.

I would also recommend this game to "leisurely or cozy gamers who like a bit of adventure". You can get lost in the game, but stop at any moment or at any stage of creation if you like.

185131143.review:
Cara, o jogo tem uma premissa interessante, tem ideias muito boas de jogabilidade, o jogo é dividido em 5 partes e é muito legal que cada uma delas é muito diferente das outras nas mecânicas e jogabilidade, cada parte é unica. Porém, pelo fato do jogo não desenvolver muito as partes, na minha opinião algumas partes do jogo ficaram um pouco massantes, na parte da civilização a partir da metade dela não existe mais desafio e só é chato ficar repetindo oque você já fez até o final, isso também acontece na parte das tribos porém ela é bem mais divertida.

Outro ponto negativo da parte final do jogo é a parte 5, da exploração espacial é extremamente massante, os diálogos de explicação são muito grandes para coisas bem simples, além de tudo ser demorado e chato de se fazer. 

O game também tem pontos fortes, na minha opinião as partes 2 e 3 (tribos e eu esqueci o nome da outra) são muito interessantes e divertidas, e evoluir e modificar a especie que nós jogadores criamos, melhorando suas características de socialização e ataque é a melhor e mais legal parte do jogo. 

Por fim, achei o jogo é mediano, com alguns momentos muito bons, e alguns momentos muito ruins que atrapalham na experiencia, acho que da para gastar seu dinheiro com coisa melhor, mas apesar disso, acredito que nos dias de hoje, uma continuação de Spore poderia ser um jogo incrível, com gráficos, mecanicas e jogabilidades atuais, tamanho de jogos atuais, e se atentando a corrigir os pontos fracos deste jogo aqui.

2,5/5

185044422.review:
TL;DR: Spore is a pretty good game that lets you create what you want.  You get multiple types of game play, however, they're not very fleshed out and can become repetitive after a while. If online features are your thing this is not the version to get, buy from EA or GOG instead. That said, game is still fully playable offline and online is not required to enjoy it.


Originally played this game years ago and bought it again on sale to re-experience it again. It's one of those games that really allow you to express your creativity. The different creators allow you to make a variety of things. If you can think it, you can make it type of thing.

The stages offer different types of game play depending on the one you're currently playing. The downside of course is that these different styles aren't fully fleshed out and can get repetitive in some cases.

This is a 2008 game so don't expect the best graphics. That said, it's not that bad and the cutesy style does help it a bit.

Unfortunately, if you want to use any of the online features that come with this game, the Steam version is not the one to use. You need to register this game using CD Keys that Steam will not provide and will have to jump through hoops to get from EA. IF you can get them from EA. If online functionality is important to you, I recommend buying the game from EA or GOG who will provide the needed CD Keys. 

Despite this, you can still play the game completely offline as online is only needed if you wish to share or download creations or to populate your worlds with the creation of other players. (There are simple workarounds to download creations offline if you really want to.)

184676580.review:
i bought this game in 2008... i'm so happy is playable again. <3

The game is an arcade "evolution simulator" that in simple ways illustrates how a bunch of bacterias ruled a planet whit the help of some billion years, passing from the primordial broth to space exploration.

This game is what i will suggest for sandbox lovers, builders, dreamers ad fans of species evolution.
Even if it is outdated i managed to get a great graphic (updated to 2024) tweaking the specific app rendering settings via NVIDIA Control Panel.

This game maybe is not great as a game itself, but if you like to create & bild stuffs and lifeforms, this is something you need to check for sure.

Top game in its simplicity, for me.

Spore: легенда, которая покоряет даже спустя годы!

Я впервые запустил Spore в 2024 году, и, честно говоря, не ожидал, что игра 2008 года так затянет. За 30 часов я прожил целую историю своей цивилизации — от маленькой клетки в океане до великой галактической империи.

Главное, что цепляет, — это свобода творчества. Создавать существ, строить города, управлять космическим флотом — каждый этап игры уникален. А визуальный стиль, хоть и немного устарел, всё ещё восхищает своей оригинальностью.

Игра удивляет глубиной, разнообразием и тем, как всё здесь работает гармонично. Даже спустя столько лет Spore остаётся настоящим шедевром. Если вы пропустили её в своё время, как я, попробуйте сейчас — оно того стоит!

Оценка: 10/10
Рекомендую всем, кто хочет испытать ностальгию по эпохе великих идей или открыть для себя что-то новое!

184149049.review:
An overly basic but still fun exploring game.
Everyone knows Spore, you make a tiny creature, eat stuff, you then put parts on it, then it walks, then it starts a village, then an empire, then it goes into space.
Usually people don't go into space, if they even go into the city stuff that is.
But i like it, it has just enough things in each stage so it pulls you in and just lets you do what you want.
Creature customization has a lot of options but is kind of hurt by the whole Limit that is placed on it, there are mods to disable it and honestly unless you care about sharing your creations online, its the right way to go.
The only issue is no stage is permanent, its only really an issue for Creature stage where eventuely you will 'finish' it and have to move on, i think there is a way to continuesly play it so you can explore and meet a lot of various creatures.
Another nice option would have been to have quick matches on the Tribal and Civilization stages for RTS battles, now sure you can create a new world but i think dedicated 'quick' match menu where you set up games would have been cool.
Big issue is DLC, i don't know why its not handled like every other Steam game, now Steam won't actually make you install 15 GB of data, it will find you Spore install and only download new things from Creepy parts and Galactic adventures, but its still odd, as for example GOG comes in as complete with all things packed in without having to mess around multi installs.
Overall solid, arguably the game actually sucks, but it pulls you in enough for it not to matter.

183878580.review:
*이 게임을 스팀에서 구매하면 안되는 이유

1. 스팀 버전만 한글을 지원 안함
 EA 앱에서 구매할 경우 기본적으로 한글이 지원됨. 그러나 스팀은 걍 한글 데이터 자체가 존재하지 않음. 여러가지 편법이나 비공식 패치를 통해서 한글을 출력시킬 순 있지만 그러한 방법들을 사용해도 크리쳐 이름 등 일부분이 여전히 번역되지 않는 채로 나오고, 우주단계에 진입하면 아예 한글 지원이 안되기 시작함. EA버전에서는 당연히 그러한 점이 없음

2. 온라인 시스템 아예 사용 불가
 EA 연동을 막아놔서 로그인 자체를 못하도록 막아놓았음. 문제는 이 게임은 다른 사람이 만든 크리쳐를 내 월드에 풀어놓거나 직접 플레이해보는 등, 온라인 컨텐츠 비중이 상당한 게임이라는 점임. 물론 온라인 없이도 혼자서 온몸 비틀어가며 크리쳐 제작하고 게임 내에 기본적으로 제공하는 기본 컨텐츠만 즐길 수 있겠지만 온라인이 연결되어있는 사람들에 비해 즐기는 컨텐츠의 양이 상당히 줄어드는 것이 사실임.
 이러한 점을 스팀페이지에 고지하지 않고서 판매하고 있는건 솔직히 소비자 기만에 부합한다고 생각함. EA랑 스팀간에 문제가 있었던 건 차치하고, 그 이후 아무런 대책 없이 CD키 막아놓고 아무 조치도 하지 않는건 좀 어이없는 처사라고 생각함. 
 사실 과거에는 몇가지 꼼수를 써서 EA에 여전히 CD키를 연결시킬 수 있었으나 그 방식이 점차 복잡해지다가 지금은 regidit으로 까봐도 CD키를 확인할 수 없는 현상까지 왕왕 목격되고 있음. DLC는 여전히 CD키가 스팀 내에서 확인 가능하다는 소문이 있던데 이건 진위여부 확인을 해봐야 할 듯. 사실 그러한 보고중에서도 'DLC만 등록하면 본편까지 EA 연동 되더라'라는 목격담과 'DLC 다 등록했는데도 본편 CD키 연결을 못하면 여전히 안되더라'라는 목격담이 혼재하는 상황이라 더더욱 어느쪽이 맞다고 확언하기 힘든 상황임.

3. 가격
 사실 스포어는 스팀에서 세일할 때 EA 앱에서도 같이 세일을 하는 경우가 잦음. 근데 가끔 보면 본편 할인율은 같은데 DLC 할인율이 차이나는 경우가 있다. 당장 24년 겨울세일도 스팀에서는 DLC를 각각 2200원에 팔고있는데 EA앱으로 접속하면 1100원에 구매할 수 있음

183692015.review: O Kukabeludo é uma espécie fascinante que exemplifica a evolução adaptativa em ambientes hostis. Originário de florestas densas e úmidas, esse predador desenvolveu um sistema único de defesa e ataque baseado em seus pelos. Seus longos e rígidos pelos são dotados de microestruturas afiadas e, ao serem agitados violentamente, podem ser lançados como pequenas farpas em direção às suas presas. Essa estratégia permite ao Kukabeludo paralisar ou ferir gravemente suas vítimas antes de se aproximar para o ataque final. Além disso, a composição dos pelos inclui uma substância irritante, que causa dor e desorientação nos alvos. Esse mecanismo não apenas garante sua sobrevivência como também reduz a competição com outros predadores locais, tornando-o um caçador altamente eficiente.

183688733.review:
Spore - Прекрасная игра для любителей сверхъестественных существ. Игра позволяет создать что угодно и никуда тебя не торопит, ведь даже если ты завершишь полосу эволюции, игра предоставит выбор - перейти на следующий этап эволюции или продолжать деградировать на своей ступени развития. 

Целью игры конечно не является создание превосходящего вида над всеми остальными, но выполнять основную задачу всё так же необязательно. Вы можете остаться на любом этапе и избивать невинных существ. К сожалению в реальной жизни так делать не рекомендуется, именно поэтому и была создана эта игра.

Скажу сразу что до Стима уже играл и смотрел по ней прохождения, поэтому немного знаю что и как. Конечно для подробного описания что происходит в игре этого мало, ведь я еще даже не создал бегающий пенис, который атакует плевком 4-ого уровня. В следующей партии исправлюсь. Судя по существам которых встречаешь по мере игры, разработчик не планировал делать таких экстравагантных мутантов, хотя смотря на издателя это очень странно. 

В любом случае, если вдруг вам станет лень создавать что-то подобное вручную вы всегда можете рассчитывать на сообщество, где можно найти хоть ползающий молоток с пушкой от КВ-2. 

После третьего этапа игра приобретает вид стратегии. Это довольно интересно, но всё-таки я считаю второй этап самым лучшим, хоть он в будущем почти ни на что кроме внешнего вида существа и не влияет. Рекомендую также всегда придерживаться середины между злыми и хорошими, то есть: 
На первом этапе держать золотую середину между Плотоядием и Травоядием, а на втором этапе придерживаться личности приспособленца и так далее.

В заключение могу добавить что игре в этом году исполнилось 16 лет, что старше половины пользователей Тик-Тока, не смотря на это игра не утратила свою актуальность, наоборот это даже плюс, ведь игра идет на любом тостере, что как раз таки для меня сыграло важную роль.

В общем всем рекомендую.

183629857.review:
“The lie of evolution is taught in our schools, and now it permeates into the most popular forms of gaming, further attempting to indoctrinate the minds of our children. I’ve become aware of a game called [i]SPORE[/i] that has gained significant traction during this Christmas season, and some of our church families are inadvertently allowing this sort of content into their homes. This is not honoring God and certainly not what we should permit our children to engage with, as it shapes their worldview away from God.”
[spoiler]-baptist Preacher circa. 2008~2009[/spoiler]

What a load of …... Ironically, this game, while controversial in its evolutionary framework for the modern weak and lost Christian(s), also serves as an unintentional testament to the beauty and complexity of intelligent design. If one seeks proof of Christ and the irrelevance of doctrines, like those perpetuated by baptist factions, consider [i]SPORE[/i]. Even as calvin turns over in ([strike]redacted[/strike]), his theological missteps pale in comparison to the truths this game brings to light. One can learn more about God and His will within this game, then from the false teachings of baptist dogma. While [i]SPORE[/i]’s foundation may lean toward secularism, its implications are far broader—and dare I say, much more profound and everlasting.

Never before has a game so creatively explored what it means to be a Creator. In [i]SPORE[/i], intelligent design is not only acknowledged but actively required by the player to shape entire ecosystems, species, and civilizations. From the single-cell stage to the exploration of an expansive galaxy, the player is asked to grapple with the questions of purpose, design, and destiny.

As you create multiple creatures and witness them interact within the broader Milky Way, deeper questions arise: What is the meaning of life? What is truly at the center of the universe? What was the point of all this creation and exploration? Could it be that the answers were already present and with us all along, just waiting for us to uncover them?

[i]SPORE[/i] offers an intriguing paradox. While it may outwardly promote secular frameworks, it also subtly hints at the necessity of an overarching intelligence guiding the universe. In this way, it inadvertently aligns itself with the very principles of design and purpose, that directly point back to the [u]Creator[/u] Himself, [b]Jesus Christ[/b]!

183542936.review:
for an old game, this offers a great sandbox and many creative options as far as character and asset creation goes. this means that you can make dozens of interesting looking things and spend hours of fun doing so. where the game somewhat falls short however is its progression and goal achievement.
first off, for a sandbox this game has a very limited path to "winning". this becomes especially visible when you get to the space age and finally meet the sort of cartel that stands between you and your goal, where there is only one realistic path to victory. i find this limitation to be distasteful compared to the many other options encountered before.
secondly, the game's UI and controls are very old and take some getting used to. this matter is exacerbated by the fact that each stage of the game comes with a slightly different control scheme and somewhat modified UI. thankfully, the UI confusion can be resolved by looking things online.
all in all this is a great game for its own time that definitely needs a remake.
